text: Linn County Jail and Sheriff's Residence is a historic jail and sheriff's residence located in Linneus, Linn County, Missouri. It was built in 1871 and is a two-story, five bay, Greek Revival style I-house constructed of concrete, wood, and brick. A one-story brick addition with basement, built as a Works Progress Administration project, was added in 1937. The building was converted to a museum in the 1970s. (includes 13 photographs from 2000) It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 2001. ==References== Category:History museums in Missouri Category:Works Progress Administration in Missouri Category:Government buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Greek Revival architecture in Missouri Category:Government buildings completed in 1871 Category:Museums in Linn County, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Linn County, Missouri
title: Linn County Jail and Sheriff's Residence
